name: Mbalageti Safari Camp Ltd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really - our jaws dropped when we entered our chalet. They are 100% luxurious. We stayed at more modest properties on our honeymoon safari, and this was a whole different level. Every details of the property and the chalet's is incredible. Beautiful beds, furniture and the best bathrooms in the Serengeti with galvanized tubs, big open shower, soaps and candles, a bidet - the works. No detail was forgotten in the construction or in the management of this property.
reviews.title: Honeymoon-worthy Luxury Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a big "welcome center" where they have couches, coffee and tea all day, baked goods, and books and a computer with spotty internet connection. The restaurant and pool building is at the tip of the property and both are part of a wonderful little complex. We enjoyed the pool on one afternoon when we got back early from a game drive -- all to ourselves! The property was very quiet in Sept., so meals were intimate and romantic and the food at all meals was delicious. The french press coffee at breakfast was a highlight.
reviews.title: Wonderful accommodation but not many animals in the area in August

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The chorus of insects and birds you can hear during the night - and the warthogs, of course! - is enchanting. We did see Bush Baby outside our room, as well as antelope, water buck, warthogs, gazelles, topi, snakes, bats and scores of unidentifiable birds (we're not bird people).
reviews.title: out there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People kept saying Wester Serengeti was not great in September, but we saw all the animals we were hoping to see and more. Plenty of activity surrounding the nearby Grumeti River. And the weather here in September is absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: A bit too much for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Masai keep close watch on the property and escort you around between the hours of 7pm and 6:30am (once it gets dark). They are all jovial and charming, as is the entire staff. So happy we stayed here.
reviews.title: Lodge with Luxurious Tented Rooms & Amazing Common Areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at Mbalageti for 2 nights during a recent safari trip. We were fortunate enough to be booked in one of the Executive Suites. The suite itself was amazing with a large outdoor deck and massive dining room area. However, at night, the room became quite warm and almost uncomfortable. Also, the electricity is shut off for a few hours overnight. The rooms have lanterns and flashlights so it was hardly an inconvenience. Most alcoholic beverages were included (with the suite booking) which was an added benefit. The property is absolutely gorgeous and the view of the sunrise from our deck was breathtaking. The food, although plentiful, was not the greatest. Meals were served buffet style which is something that I don't particularly care for. The staff at the property was cordial and accommodating but for the most part, they did not go out of their way like the staff from the other lodges we visited. I'm guessing that this may be due to the size of the property and number of rooms.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property & Great Bush Dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Mbalageti did have some nice extras. We took part in a walking safari which was quite fun and the guide was knowledgeable and very friendly. We also had a Bush Dinner which was an unbelievably, amazing experience. This was also where I felt the Mbalageti staff really stepped up to the plate. We were driven away from the main property to an open area that was beautifully decorated with lanterns. There was a dining table set up right out in the open and a chef and servers were preparing a feast for us. It was an exciting and frightening experience at the same time because there was always the chance that an animal could come by to visit and we heard sounds in the distance. The food and service at the Bush Dinner was incredible. This experience should not be missed!
reviews.title: Awesome property with a great view of the plains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mbalageti Safari camp is well located and offers an amazing view of the Serengeti plains. We stayed in the Tented Chalets and the view was spectacular. Unfortunately, our timing was not good as the plains had a deserted look at this time of the year. We were suitably rewared with good game viewing when we drove to Serenora in central Serengeti, about 2 hours from the Safari camp. Closer to our camp we saw a beautiful pride of Lions, a big herd of Elephants but it was dry.
reviews.title: What a treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the camp were good but service was not the best. We were 2 families with children and had taken 4 chalets. Initially we were given chalets not even remotely close to each other though we had booked in advance. After a lot of debate we got all 4 chalets next to each other. The picnic lunches packed for us were meagre. Although, have to admit that the chef was good and made special meal for us on request.
reviews.title: Amazing setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The safari vehicles didn't have radio or any other form of communication and it was difficult to get news from other drivers about animal sightings. Sometimes we drove around in circles till we met someone on the way and got information. We had about 9 flat tyres during our 6 day trip.
reviews.title: Warm, genuine, and caring staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the tented chalets. The room was nice and clean. The view was excellent. The staff was professional. The food was the best among the different lodgings that we had during our two-week safari.
reviews.title: nice lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed this lodge. The view from our tented lodge was one of the best. Nights sounds here surpassed other lodges. Great location for the Spring Migration. The Rooms were very nice with plenty of comfort and style. It was very clean and the bathroom was nice. The shower floor grid can be a little uncomfortable, especially for my wife. The food was good to sometimes very good. Their dessert tarts were outstanding. The service was above many of the lodges stayed in. George our server was fun. The masai who walk you back and forth from your room at night were not very fun compared to other places and seemed interested in tips a bit more here. The have a computer with free internet in the lobby. Although it was VERY slow it was pretty cool to send an email from the Serengeti. I would not hesitate to recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Qaulity Serengeti lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights here while on safari. It was a delightful setting with incredible views. Stayed in a tented lodge and had fun listening being so close to the outdoors. I was not feeling well when I arrived and the staff went out of their way to show concern. All of the staff enjoyed conversing in my (very limited) Swahili and teaching me new words. Would definitely stay here again, and will recommend it to anyone headed that way. Oh, the fact that the wildebeest migration was virtually at Mbalageti's doorstep helped me have such a wonderful time!
reviews.title: Fantastic-- highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beautiful scenery, very nice staff, good food, and a recreation center.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms on the rocky outcrop overlooking the Seregetti are large and very nice. They are quite hot though. The restaurant has a nice view to.
reviews.title: The only dissapointment in our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: wow, out of no where you find a resort like this. It was incredible and we wished we could of spent more time there. the views were fantastic. we stayed in the tents which were extremely nice. I loved the old fashion bath tub on the verada looking out at the park. The service great, food was great but the views were incredible. i would go back there in a blink
reviews.title: wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely,beautiful,luxurious place to stay.Beautiful accomidations,excellent staff,excellent food, and close to fantastic game viewing. This was the best of 6 places we stayed on a two week safari, all of them nice, but this was a another level
reviews.title: wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed there in a lodge rooms, very clean and located far from the main building, so we had real live animals coming to our veranda! small dik-dik antilopes came for a visit, some impalas and monkeys. we were escorted by masai from and to the rooms when it was dark.
reviews.title: great comfort in the middle of the wild

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this lodge has the best possible location - on a top of a hill with great view over the valley. you can just have a drink at the bar or swim in the pool and look down at the animals walking by.
reviews.title: Great camp with nice view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this lodge has big territory, building are located on a distance one from another, so even with many visitors it's still not crowded and very quiet.
reviews.title: Fantastic

aka: Mbalageti Safari Camp Ltd Hotel Serengeti National Park
